p_1.title: digital darkage studios
p_1.description: A new website I designed and developed for Digital Dark Age Studios LLC. For this project I aimed to learn and implement Next.js and Video.js.

p_2.title: deployment app
p_2.description: This app was created to store my hardware deployments at my current job. I created this to allow my team to easily search for hardware we deployed, while also making it easier to deploy multiple items to multiple users from one page.

p_3.title: hunt conductor
p_3.description: This app was designed to assist with scouting for hunt trains in Final Fantasy XIV. Instead of using a spreadsheet and having to copy over coordinates for marks, I wanted to be able to just open a map and click their coordinates. I also wanted the route to be optimized, so I made sure to calculate the distance of each mark from the closest teleport.

p_4.title: KeithAlleman.com
p_4.description: This is the website you're currently viewing. I built this project to display my work while also providing some insight into the person behind the work. This is actually the second version of this website and it is now built with Svelte.

p_5.title: eviCore Signature Creator
p_5.description: This was the first web app that I developed. I utilized bootstrap & javascript to create a tool that allowed users to build an Outlook signature. I learned quite a bit about bootstrap and refactoring for functionality accross older browsers (we used IE8 & IE10 still). It was a great project to get my feet wet with and was regularly used for new hire classes within the company. This app was hosted on one of our internal servers using WAMP.

p_6.title: Meraki VLAN updater
p_6.description: After using the bulk import tool within the meraki dashboard, this script can be ran to update the VLAN for each network so there's no need to individually edit each meraki.

p_7.title: Meraki Last Seen
p_7.description: A script that process a list of networks and find networks that have not reached out to the meraki dashboard in over 4 months.

p_8.title: Meraki Network Finder
p_8.description: A script that will process a list of networks and find networks that are not created in the Meraki dashboard.
